meanings.definition: A thing whose name one does not know or cannot recall.
meanings.sent1: Can you pass me that whatsit over there?
meanings.sent2: I always lose track of my whatsit when I need it the most.
meanings.sent3: I found a mysterious whatsit in the attic that no one could identify.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a jumbled box of whatsits, each one a mystery waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The whatsit in the corner turned out to be a rare antique worth a fortune.

meanings.sent1: The new whatsit in the kitchen makes cooking so much easier.
meanings.sent2: I always carry a handy whatsit in my bag for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The quirky inventor unveiled his latest whatsit that could do almost anything.
meanings.sent4: Her phone was like a magical whatsit that connected her to the world.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic whatsit beeped and whirred as it performed its task flawlessly.

meanings.definition: A person or thing whose name is unknown or forgotten.
meanings.sent1: Who was that whatsit we met at the party last week?
meanings.sent2: I bumped into an old whatsit from high school at the store.
meanings.sent3: The detective was determined to solve the case of the mysterious whatsit.
meanings.sent4: In the shadows, a dark figure lurked like a sinister whatsit.
meanings.sent5: The elusive whatsit remained a puzzle, teasing the curious minds around it.
